thread.title: Camden Hills announces Oct. 9-10 homecoming schedule
thread.title_full: Camden Hills announces Oct. 9-10 homecoming schedule

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Camden Hills announces Oct. 9-10 homecoming schedule
text:
Camden Hills announces Oct. 9-10 homecoming schedule By Staff | Oct 05, 2015 Courtesy of: Camden Hills Regional High School The bleachers at Don Palmer Field on the Camden Hills Regional High School campus should be filled with those celebrating the school's homecoming Oct. 9-10. 
Rockport — Camden Hills Regional High School has announced its schedule for the Windjammers' homecoming celebration on Friday and Saturday, Oct. 9-10, an event school officials hope will attract fans and alumni to support the fall sports teams. 
The weekend will feature many of the school's fall athletic programs, including cross country, mountain biking, field hockey and boys and girls soccer. 
This year's event also will recognize fall athletes from the cross country, girls soccer and mountain biking teams, which will participate in their final regular-season contests. 
The food tent will be open from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. and refreshments are free. 
The varsity boys soccer team also will collect canned food items for the area food pantry. 
The weekend schedule follows: 
1 p.m. — School pep rally. 
Friday, Oct. 9 
4 p.m. — Camden Hills cross-country invitational. 
Saturday, Oct. 10 
8:30 a.m. — 5K fun run, hosted by Camden Hills cross-country team. Entry fee is $15. Contact coach Helen Bonzi by email at hbonzi@mac.com. 
10 a.m. — Freshman boys soccer versus Mount Ararat of Topsham. 
11 a.m. — Mountain bike meet at the Camden Snow Bowl. 
12:50 p.m. — Opening welcome with principal Dr. Nick Ithomitis. 
12:55 p.m. — National anthem performed by Camden Hills Chamber Singers and Women's Choir led by CHRHS choral director Kim Murphy. 
1 p.m. — Varsity girls soccer versus Lawrence of Fairfield. 
1 p.m. — Varsity field hockey versus Erskine Academy of South China. 
1 p.m. — Junior varsity boys soccer versus Mount Blue of Farmington. 
1:40 p.m. — Athletic director Steve Alex introduces honorary team of the day: The three original school alumni associations, including the Appleton Huskies, the Rockport Beavers and the Camden Mustangs. These three schools eventually formed Camden-Rockport High School and now Camden Hills Regional High School. 
2:30 p.m. — Junior varsity girls soccer versus Lawrence. 
2:30 p.m. — Junior varsity field hockey versus Erskine Academy. 
3 p.m. — Varsity boys soccer versus Mount Blue. 
3:40 p.m. — Ithomitis introduces honorary fan of the day — longtime Camden Hills Regional High School teacher Liz Dailey. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
